entry.title: Help & Donate
entry.summary: If you liked what we're doing and would like to support our work, you can donate in three ways: 1. Volunteer remote work - with…
entry.content:
If you liked what we're doing and would like to support our work, you can donate in three ways:

1. Volunteer remote work - with the content, website, social networks etc.
2. Volunteer offline work - on the spot help with event organising (example: multimedia engineers, hands-on help, etc.).
3. Donate directly (crypto or fiat) to our community.

We are setting up the non-commercial entity now that will accept donations.

Meanwhile, you can donate directly to organiser:

Den Ivanov (Linkedin, Facebook, Telegram)

entry.title: Feedback
entry.summary: We are always striving to improve the quality of our events and would like to hear your feedback. What we could improve? Change? Embrace? Tell…
entry.content:
We are always striving to improve the quality of our events and would like to hear your feedback.

What we could improve? Change? Embrace? Tell us!

We're working on making a completely free (from tracking etc) feedback form for you to fill.

Right now, please share your feedback directly to me (Den Ivanov) or via my PM email (sxiii at pm dot me)

If you liked our event, you can also support us by:

  • doing an awesome speech on important topic, 
  • inviting a guest speaker,
  • becoming a partner,
  • taking a bunch of friends on the next ITM event, 
  • joining us and sharing your feedback on the social networks, 
  • helping as volunteer or donating.

entry.title: Partners
entry.summary: Main venue partner: Rebel Media partner: Web3 Fjord Information partner: Daily Scandinavian We are always open for high-quality partnerships! If you'd like to give a…
entry.content:
Main venue partner: Rebel
Media partner: Web3 Fjord
Information partner: Daily Scandinavian

We are always open for high-quality partnerships!

If you'd like to give a speech, please read our "Topics", "Quality" and "Presentations" sections.

If you'd like to join on of our events, please check the home page or "Events" section.

You can contact us via the "About us" page.

entry.title: Topics
entry.summary: There are a wide list of topics that we're ready to discuss and cover on our events. Topic focuses (list can and will be extended,…
entry.content:
There are a wide list of topics that we're ready to discuss and cover on our events.

Topic focuses (list can and will be extended, so please contact us if you have a different talk anyway):

  • Crypto, Blockchain, FinTech & DAO
  • Startups, Pitches, Kickstarting, Crowdfunding, Ideas
  • Business Improvement, Success Stories, Challenges, Management Efficiency, etc.
  • Open-source Software, Linux & Unix, Development stacks, Programming languages
  • Open-source Hardware, Development, Use-cases
  • Networks, Network Security & Audit, Network Tooling, Data Centers & Monitoring
  • Cyber Security, Malware analysis, System Audit and Prevention, Logging
  • AI, NN, Language Models
  • Computer Game Design, Board Game Development
  • Cities of the future, futurology
  • Energy Sector
  • Communications
  • Consulting & Advising & Legal
  • Design, Architecture
  • Press, Journalism
  • Agriculture
  • Medical tech
  • Biology and bio-engineering, implants, sextech
  • Education & Meetups
  • Content production - movies, videos, audio, singing (making, editing)

Our events might be interesting for you, if you're one of these guys:

  • Software & hardware electronics enthusiast
  • Geek & nerd in one of the above mentioned fields
  • Prefer to open-source everything
  • Interested in AI & Robotics
  • Making own business or interested in becoming an entrepreneur
  • Looking into the future

Past presentations on the following topics can be found in the "Presentations" section.

If you would like to send a paper, talk, or a presentation, please do so on the according page "Papers".

entry.content:

Location: Rebel
Address: Universitetsgata 2, Oslo
Date & Time: 21 June 2024, 17:00
RSVP: on meetup
Map & Route: OpenStreetMap, Google map, Mapiliary, Other maps)

Meanwhile, check out our past events.

Please use the top navigation menu to learn more about our events and community.

entry.title: About us
entry.summary: We are International Tech Meetups - combination of decentralised and Oslo-based community. We do Tech Events, Streams. We support the best communities and invite the…
entry.content:
We are International Tech Meetups - combination of decentralised and Oslo-based community.

We do Tech Events, Streams. We support the best communities and invite the best speakers. And, most importantly, we try to do things right.

Feel free to reach out us at post@itmeet.top.

Former community name: META*.

Non-commercial association registration is in process.

entry.title: Tools
entry.summary: Our favourites List of great tools that we use and can recommend. Include flexible, modular, open-source tools that are extremely useful in the according situations…
entry.content:
Our favourites

List of great tools that we use and can recommend. Include flexible, modular, open-source tools that are extremely useful in the according situations (software, hardware, and beyond).

Feel free to send suggestions and feedback, do a speech about the according software or hardware product, or just browse around and gain knowledge.

Full transparency and neutrality note: all the tools in this section are our personal recommendations. None of this section or any other sections of this website is sponsored by anyone.  

Hardware

  • Framework Laptops
  • MNT Reform - Dev ARM Laptop
  • Raspberry Pi, Orange Pi (prototyping)
  • Steam Deck (mobility, gaming)

Software

  • Arch Linux (literally used for everything)
  • Firefox web browser
  • Publii (used to make this website)
  • Suckless Toolkit - recommended software that heavily follows KISS principles

Maker software

  • OpenSCAD - parametric modelling
  • Cura - 3D print preparation & slicing
  • Blender - modelling
